statement.p: The loudness, \displaystyle{L}, of a sound (measured in decibels, dB) is inversely proportional to the square of the distance, \displaystyle{d}, from the source of the sound.
When a person 12 feet from a jetski, it is 70.0 decibels loud. How loud is the jetski when the person is 49 feet away?
Round using the rules of significant figures.Â
